channel.title: [PI] Making Item Cost PKP [PI]
channel.description:
Hi, I'm working on a PI based server and for some reason, I'm having trouble making Korasi cost PKP. I've added it to the ShopAssistant.java. Here's the a snippet of the code: [code]case 11694: //AGS return 950; case 18786: //Korasi ID return 975; //Price of Korasi case 6585: return 15;[/code]
Obviously the case is the ID of Korasi and the return should be the cost (PKP) of the item but after I compile it and all, it will always say that Korasi costs 0PKP. Does anyone know why?
My whole ShopAssistant.java can be found [url=http://pastebin.com/mfDyWkZF]here.[/url]
Any help would be nice :D

item.title: [PI] Making Item Cost PKP [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Gizcat Gizcat
item.description:
@Gizcat wrote:

it still didnt work

Edit: No one? This is beginning to get annoying

item.title: [PI] Making Item Cost PKP [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Gizcat Gizcat
item.description:
@Gizcat wrote:

I already have that.
The AGS, BGS, etc. already has prices but this just won’t work for Korasi and other items I’m adding

item.title: [PI] Making Item Cost PKP [PI]
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[code]if (c.myShopId == ##) {
if (PK POINT INT >= getSpecialItemValue(itemID)) {
if (c.getItems().freeSlots() > 0){
PK POINT INT -= getSpecialItemValue(itemID);
c.getItems().addItem(itemID,1);
c.getItems().resetItems(3823);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“You do not have enough points to buy this item.”);
}

		}[/code]

you’ll have to fill it out

Read full topic

Obviously the case is the ID of Korasi and the return should be the cost (PKP) of the item but after I compile it and all, it will always say that Korasi costs 0PKP. Does anyone know why?
